resources.string:
Update Nov. 21. eMusic.com update their website and broke downlaods in this app. Downloads have been disabled until I can reach out to eMusic and get a fix.

The FOSS eMusic application allows users to browse/search the eMusic.com collection and contains a download manager enabling current eMusic.com subcribers to download purchased albums/audiobooks/tracks directly to their Android phone.

If you are outside the US and often get the message that albums are not available in your region, please set your country code in the preferences.

This app is not in any way officially associated with eMusic.com. It is developed by one developer. If you like it, use it often, and want to show your appreciation, please consider buying the supporter version of the application!

To use FOSS eMusic, you should search or browse for an album/audiobook you want to download within the app. Press on the buy button on an album page to open a webview window for that album, sign in to your eMusic account (allow the webview to save your login credentials) and then press on a download link to download the album or track of interest using the included download manager. Note, you must be an eMusic.com subscriber with sufficient credits for any purchase you try to make. Downloaded tracks are automatically added to the Android music player library.

Tracks remain in the download manager until you clear them by pressing menu and selecting "Clear Completed". Note that downloads do expire after 24 hours - requiring you to start the download process again by repurchasing (unfortunately eMusic no longer allows you to redownload an album for free).

What to do if your download fails?

Long press on the track in the download manager list that has failed and select "retry" then press the download button at the top to restart the downloads. If you accidentally cleared the downloads, press the Menu button in the download manager and then press ".emx files" to reload your purchased album. If that fails, return to the "emx files" menu and press and hold on the .emx file for your album, select "send" and email the file and the album name to jdeslipandroid@gmail.com.

If we cannot resolve your issue, you must contact eMusic customer service at http://www.emusic.com/contact/index.html to ask for your credits to be restored.
Please wait for page to refresh before attempting another download.
No storage available to buffer - sdcard and emmc missing.
Sample not available for your location. Please set your proper region in the preferences.
Couldn\'t get album info.\nEither no network connection or API is down.
Couldn\'t get artist info.\nEither no network connection or API is down.
Couldn\'t get book info.\nEither no network connection or API is down.
Playing all samples in order. To play an individual sample, hit back and then press on the track name.
Search failed - likely no network connection or API is down or yielding no results. Please try the request again.
Can\'t parse file! Not in .emx format. Try logging-out and re-logging-in on the webview page and make sure you have enough credits for the purchase.
Parsing Album Info. Please wait - checking file
Parsing Album Info. Please wait - checking file 1 of
Pick a file for EMD. Then press \'Open\'.
Really Quit? This will end all current and pending downloads. Press the Home button instead to keep running in the background.
There doesn\'t appear to be an sdcard mounted at /sdcard or internal storage at /emmc. \n\nFOSS eMusic has no location to save files. This is one sad Robot.
You need to pause and restart the downloads for changes in filename/directory preferences to take effect.
No current download - \nPress the menu button and select \'About\' for usage info.
The Download Manager curently can only parse 100 tracks per album. Your download contains
tracks. Only the first 100 will be added. Please contact the developer if you see this message.
Using cached .emx file.\n\nSelect \"Clear All\" from the menu if links are missing/expired.
\nWill automatically try again after all downloads finish.
\nTo try again, manually press restart after all downloads finish.
Failed to update chart info. Either no network connection or API down.
Cleared chart and album art cache.
Database is currently locked. Please try again in a few seconds.
Waiting 10 seconds to retry new or incomplete tracks
Not finished yet, so entering another download attempt
EMusicDroid downloads were killed by the Android OS (probably due to low memory on the device). Please restart manually.
Do you really want to delete %s?
